body_html:
fixed via f74665f

However, we do need to figure out how to give users gcc 4.xx because CUDA8's nvcc doesn't support gcc 5 and above. I think CUDA9 nvcc doesn't support 7.2.0 which is what gcc_linux-64 will give you.
body_text:
fixed via f74665f
However, we do need to figure out how to give users gcc 4.xx because CUDA8's nvcc doesn't support gcc 5 and above. I think CUDA9 nvcc doesn't support 7.2.0 which is what gcc_linux-64 will give you.
body:
fixed via https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commit/f74665f0c4b0caa8d667cd8d3e2bb764ac92bae0

However, we do need to figure out how to give users gcc 4.xx because CUDA8's `nvcc` doesn't support gcc 5 and above. I think CUDA9 `nvcc` doesn't support `7.2.0` which is what `gcc_linux-64` will give you.
